text:
Deﬁnition 2.13 (Generating Set and Span). Consider a vector space V =
(V,+,·) and set of vectors A= {x1,..., xk}⊆V . If every vector v ∈
Vcan be expressed as a linear combination of x1,..., xk, Ais called a
generating set of V. The set of all linear combinations of vectors in Aisgenerating set
called the span of A. If Aspans the vector spaceV, we write V = span[A]span
or V = span[x1,..., xk].
Generating sets are sets of vectors that span vector (sub)spaces, i.e.,
